title: Taxes, permits and harvests
text:
Upon the request of an Indian tribe, ESAC may request that the purchaser of the forest products of such tribe, which are harvested under a timber sale contract, permit, or other harvest sale document, make advance deposits, or direct payments of the gross proceeds of such forest products, less any amounts segregated as forest management deductions pursuant to section 163.25, into accounts designated by such Indian tribe.
If in the past or presently the purchaser has been found of employing a disabled person under the Act III., the purchaser is excluded from this obligation.

The deposit can be made into an account that the tribe (you) chooses.

questions: An exception to paying the deposit can be made if

questions.text: the purchaser employs someone with a disability
the purchaser will pay twice the amount of deposit next year
you made the request to ESAC last year
the committee decides the purchasers does not have to pay

questions: Who makes the request and who pays the deposit?

questions.text: request - the purchser, deposit - the purchaser

questions: For what kind of goods can the request be applied?

questions.text: forest products under harvest sale document
all goods for which forest managements deductdions apply
any goods listed in the request
